title: National Park Would Memoralize Manhattan Project
teaser: From 1942 to 1945, the U.S. government's Manhattan Project produced the world's first atomic bombs. A new national park, preserving the project's buildings and artifacts, is now in the works. Melissa Block speaks with Cynthia Kelly of the Atomic Heritage Foundation who has pushed for the preservation plan for 15 years.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
